bill_title: provide for a study the issue of creating the Kadoka-Caputa Rails to Hope Trail as a state park.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for a study the issue of creating the Kadoka-Caputa Rails to Hope Trail as a state park. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Transportation Commission shall conduct a study of advisability and feasibility of establishing a state park, to be known as the Kadoka-Caputa Rails to Hope State Park and consisting of land within the right-of-way of the portion of state-owned rail line between Kadoka and Caputa in Jackson and Pennington counties. The study shall be under the supervision of the commission and staffed by the Department of Transportation and shall include the opportunity for public input. The commission shall submit its recommendations and any draft legislation to the Governor and the Legislature not later than December 15, 2011. 135 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.075 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
